meanings.definition: A piece of metal or wood used to connect parts of a machine.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic inserted the gib to secure the engine parts.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the gib for any signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The gib rolled off the workbench and caused a clatter.
meanings.sent4: The gib acted like a bridge, linking the two machine components together.
meanings.sent5: The shiny gib gleamed under the workshop lights, holding the machine steady.

meanings.sent1: He will gib the gears together to prevent them from slipping.
meanings.sent2: Remember to gib the pieces tightly for a secure fit.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally gibbed her shoelaces together and had to untangle them.
meanings.sent4: The idea gibbed his attention, making him focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The strong adhesive gibbed the materials together seamlessly.
